net.sf.mmm.client.ui.api.widget.panel

Interface UiWidgetTabPanel

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AbstractValidatableObject, Accessibility, AttributeReadAriaRole, AttributeReadDisposed, AttributeReadEnabled, AttributeReadHtmlId, AttributeReadId<String>, AttributeReadMode, AttributeReadModeFixed, AttributeReadModified, AttributeReadPrimaryStyle, AttributeReadStyles, AttributeReadStylesAdvanced, AttributeReadTooltip, AttributeReadVisible, AttributeReadVisibleRecursive, AttributeWriteDisposed, AttributeWriteEnabled, AttributeWriteHtmlId, AttributeWriteId<String>, AttributeWriteMode, AttributeWriteModeFixed, AttributeWritePrimaryStyle, AttributeWriteStyles, AttributeWriteStylesAdvanced, AttributeWriteTooltip, AttributeWriteVisible, AttributeWriteVisibleAdvanced, UiFeature, UiFeatureEvent, UiFeatureMessages, UiFeatureMode, UiWidget, UiWidgetAbstractComposite, UiWidgetComposite<UiWidgetTab>, UiWidgetDynamicComposite<UiWidgetTab>, UiWidgetDynamicPanel<UiWidgetTab>, UiWidgetMultiComposite<UiWidgetTab>, UiWidgetNative, UiWidgetPanel<UiWidgetTab>, UiWidgetRegular, UiWidgetRegularComposite<UiWidgetTab>, UiWidgetSwitchComposite<UiWidgetTab>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractUiWidgetTabPanel, UiWidgetTabPanelGwt, UiWidgetTabPanelTestImpl

    public interface UiWidgetTabPanel
extends UiWidgetDynamicPanel<UiWidgetTab>, UiWidgetSwitchComposite<UiWidgetTab>, UiWidgetNative
    This is the interface for a panel widget that represents a tab panel. It contains a number of children but only shows one of them at a time. On the top it shows a tab header with the labels of its children. The user can click on one of these tabs in order to see the actual content of the according tab.
    This design might look a little complicated but gives a lot more flexibility for setting and changing attributes of the tab. For convenience usage there is also addChild(UiWidgetRegular, String).
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

    • Method Detail

      • addChild

        UiWidgetTab addChild(UiWidgetRegular child,
                     String label)
        This method adds the given UiWidgetRegular as new tab on the right of all existing tabs. This is a convenience method for the following code: 
         UiWidgetTab tab = widgetFactory.create(UiWidgetTab.class);
 tab.setTitle(title);
 tab.setChild(child);
 tabPanel.addChild(tab);
        Parameters:
        child - is the child widget to add. The given component instance must be created by the same factory.
        label - is the label that will be displayed to identify the tab.
        Returns:
        the UiWidgetTab for this tab. It allows to change the title, set tooltip or image (icon), etc.
